The claim alleges that 500: 000 mail-in ballots were sent to dead people and pets in Virginia, and 200,000 in Nevada.
The Center for Voter Information: a nonprofit organization, acknowledges that there were problems with 500,000 absentee ballot applications in Virginia that were mailed with incorrect return envelopes.
The CEO and president of the Center for: Tom Lopach, states that they are not aware of any ballot applications going to pets or deceased people, as their mailing list consists of registered voters on record with the state.
The printing vendor for the Center for V: Smith-Edwards-Dunlap Co., admits that the mistake occurred due to an incorrectly aligned spreadsheet that matched voters with their local election office.
